data.title: Great food, friends and service
data.text: My friends and I had met for dinner one night this week at brew because we had seen great reviews and heard great things about it. We sat outside near the street as it was a lovely evening and shared an appetizer of deviled eggs and spinach artichoke dip which was excellent. The devil export particularly special as far as I'm concerned and I let the ladies eat the rest of them. For dinner I got the jambalaya stuffed red bell peppers and they were excellent. The dish came with a nice dirty rice and had chicken and andouille sausage in it as well. excellent meal and excellent service provided by John as well nice friendly fella. We were a little disappointed to find that they had no after dinner coffee beverages of any kind. We did share in the one desert they offer which is beignets and they were very good.

data.title: Great little lunch spot
data.text: Located in the heart of historic Roswell on Canton Street. Great food, casual & comfortable atmosphere, good for a business lunch or a day out with girlfriends. Extensive menu with unique and tasty options. Will visit again and again!

data.title: Good food at a good price.
data.text: The food and service has always been very good. We've had lunch on several occasions had have always come away with a pleasant experience. It's also one of a few Cajun resterants in the area.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: I am giving this 5 stars because I believe they deserve it. My wife and I just toured The Archibald Smith Plantation and were looking to find a nice place that served lunch. I wanted a burger and so did my wife. We walked past a few restaurants right on Canton, the main drag of the historic section of Roswell. There really are quite a few to choose from and all were quite busy and probably all with good food. We stopped at Roux and our server got us a table right on the side walk looking at the people and cars and the old buidings around us. Really quite enjoyable. Our server was Sam, a young woman, who really was attentive of our needs. The food was excellent and so were our drinks. If I lived in this area I would go here quite often.

data.title: Wonderful Fun Place
data.text: We enjoyed excellent service and wonderful food. They were extremely busy on a Saturday lunch. They had enough people working to handle the crowd with ease. This was our first visit and are looking forward to going back.

data.title: A new entry to my favorites list
data.text: Our party of two couples arrived at 5:30pm on a glorious fall evening to find all al fresco tables occupied. Without hesitation the group at one table offered to move inside and allow us our preference. While sipping one the signature cocktails I spied the group who had given us their table. I then recognized the leader of that group as the general manager of Roux and realized he had interrupted his meeting to put  that our wishes above his meeting. I would return here even if the food were not as good as it is, just because management here understands hospitality much better than most.

data.title: Friday afternoon drinks
data.text: Stopped by for Friday afternoon drinks and a snack. We had the pretzel and the BBQ chips. The food was typical bar food but good quality. We had beer and wine. Good selection of beers. Service was good however the restaurant had a bar smell to it.

data.title: Excellent lunch
data.text: Highly recommended. Two of our party enjoyed the fish tacos and I LOVED the buffalo shrimp tacos and excellent pasta salad as my side. Two tacos plus side provides plenty of food for lunch. Very good service. Small space on Canton St. dominated by old wooden bar that also has limited outdoor seating right on the sidewalk. Original bricks and creaky wooden floors add character. Nice selection of craft beers.

user_location.name: Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States

data.title: scored a "10" for PO-boy!!
data.text: First time visit for this MS traveler and I always order a shrimp PO-boy when I go to a New Orleans style restaurant! This one was superb! Crusty French bread, remoulade sauce and home made sweet potato fries!! Delish!!It was a gorgeous day so ate outside--prompt seating for a noonish lunch. Excellent staff and service!! Was too full to rate the beignets! Great experience!!

data.title: Love the Beignets
data.text: Roux is one of many small restaurants on Canton Street in Roswell (which has become a culinary destination).  The restaurant is very small but they do have outside seating where it is fun to sit and people watch.  I had the Oyster Po Boy which was excellent and of course the Beignets (sometimes we will go there at night, have a cup of coffee and a Beignet.    The inside can get crowded and noisy so I recommend getting there early or at off times.  Service was very good.  It is always fun to walk along Canton Street, look at the shops or go over the the small square and sit on the benches. Main problem is parking...lots charge $5.00 but if you can always park in the parking lot of Roswell Methodist on Mimosa Ave. for free and walk to Canton Street. On the 3rd Thursday May thru Oct, there is Alive After Five on Canton Street and traffic is blocked off so be aware of this as it is very crowded from 4-4:30 till whenever. Check with Roswell Visitor Center as months & times could change.

data.title: Excellent pub grub
data.text: A good bar with food that's a step above. Great place to eat outdoors. Consistent service and you can almost always get a table.

data.title: Wonderful lunch
data.text: We grabbed a table outside on a beautiful Saturday and enjoyed the food and people watching. They specialize in Cajun but excel in flash fried goodies, like pickles and okra and seafood sampler. The fish tacos are tasty and fresh, shrimp and grits are fabulous because their grits are the best! Tomato basil soup is rich and delicious.

data.title: Great lunch!
data.text: Stopped for lunch on a Saturday with family and friends. Our party of 7 was seated quickly.  Excellent service - friendly and attentive.  Everyone raved about his/her selection, especially the Quinoa Bowl and the Roux Bleu Burger which my husband said was the best burger he'd ever tasted!  Great place.  We will definitely be going back.

data.title: Great meal and beer too
data.text: I was drawn in by the 12 rotating craft beers on tap. Had a great double IPA from Wicked Weed and some oysters on half shell which were great. Then selected the salmon with jalapeño cheddar grits. It was excellent. If you are in Roswell you must go here.

data.title: Nice evening
data.text:
Went out with a colleague for dinner.  We were seated immediately outside at one of the tables.  Nice wine menu, food was fantastic(I got the fried chicken), wonderful service.

Fairly inexpensive evening considering we purchased a bottle of wine.  I would go here again!

data.title: Great "Po Oyster and Shrimp  rolls...
data.text: Love to stop in for lunch with special out of town guests or celebrate my sons birthdays.  They love the oysters and New Orleans cuisine offered there.  But, I do wish they would serve a good robust coffee when we order beignets.

data.title: Will definitely go back!
data.text: What a great little place!  Met with friends on a Saturday night.  They don't take reservations, which was fine.  Friends were able to order drinks while we waited outside for our table.  It's a pretty tiny place with a bar and seating outside, but I loved the environment.  Our server was very attentive and gave great recommendations.  The food was INCREDIBLE with really unique pairings.  We ordered the barbque nachos and substituted the feta cheese for goat cheese.  They were so amazing!!  I also loved the Gouda mashed potatoes!  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Will definitely go back
data.text: If you want a spot in historic Roswell this is a winner.  You gotta like Cajun food and if you do it's pretty good!   Good service and quality with a covered patio area in case you want to have a little elbow room.  Give it a try!

data.title: Gourmet Pub Food
data.text:
Spending a few hours in Roswell last week, my wife and I happened upon this cozy and inviting pub restaurant.
The food was gourmet quality, but yet still pub style.
If you like brussel sprouts even just a little, try the appetizer; a delicious combo of grilled brussels, cranberries, drizzled balsamic and just the right amount of bacon.  I had a very flavorful gumbo with added crawfish, and my wife enjoyed the turkey wrap, with layered flavors that worked together quite well and quite unique.
The service and friendly atmosphere matched the food.  Nice selection of wine and beer.
This place was an unexpected treat and a great value.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: It's on my "repeat" list. virtually everything is tastes great in my opinion. They always have a good beer selection. Two things holding it back from five stars: 1) The live music gets a little too loud for my taste, and 2) They need to get Gate City on tap, if they haven't already.
